definition: A set of protocols and tools that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.
A method to frequently deliver apps by introducing automation into the stages of app development.
A distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.
example: git commit, git push, git merge

definition: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers.
An architectural style for designing networked applications using stateless communication protocols.
A technique that lets you query and manipulate data from a database using an object-oriented paradigm.
Five design principles intended to make software designs more understandable, flexible, and maintainable.
A principle aimed at reducing repetition of code by abstracting common logic.
An architectural pattern that separates an application into three main components.
A syntax extension for JavaScript that allows writing HTML-like code in JavaScript files.
